nodes.text: The DH-X heavy blaster rifle was a model of heavy blaster rifle manufactured by BlasTech Industries. One of the heaviest rifles in the company's catalogue, the weapon was popular with mercenaries, especially those of larger species that could wield it with ease.

The DH-X heavy blaster rifle was a cumbersome model of long-range heavy blaster rifle that was designed to punch a hole the size of a smashball through any target within sight. The weapon had a short and squat barrel with a durasteel finish and a long emitter nozzel. This was unusual for a heavy blaster, as most had designs with long, thin barrels. DH-Xs came standard with a buttstock made of solid composite alloy and a monocular targeting optics suite.

The DH-X heavy blaster rifle was manufactured by BlasTech Industries and was one of the company's heaviest rifles, costing 1,000 credits. It was popular with mercenaries, especially with larger species such as Wookiees and Barabels who could wield the large weapon with ease. Due to its size, smaller or weaker users would attach miniature repulsor pods onto the DH-X to aid them in using it. Others mounted the weapon on a vehicle such as a speeder bike sidecar.

The DH-X heavy blaster rifle was mentioned in the new Star Wars canon in the 2019 roleplaying supplement Gadgets and Gear, published by Fantasy Flight Games. It originated in the Star Wars Legends continuity, where it was created for the 2014 roleplaying supplement Dangerous Covenants, also published by Fantasy Flight Games.
